China Edition was announced in Water Cube, Beijing. Delegates of Mojang Studios, Microsoft, and NetEase attended.
Beta server closed without saving data.
Minecraft server Hypixel announced that a China-exclusive server was to open.
Windows Java Edition test started again with restricted users being allowed to join. Hypixel was available from then on.
Windows Java Edition test started with unrestricted users being allowed to join.
The pocket edition is now available in App Store.
Public beta test of China Edition on Android started.
Users of China Edition on Android reached over 14 million.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.2.0 was released for Mobile.
Registered users for China Edition on all platforms reached over 60 million.
Developer Platform for China Edition was opened.
Registered users for China Edition on all platforms reached over 100 million.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.4.0 was released for Mobile.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.4.0 was released for Windows.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.5.0 was released for Mobile and Windows.
Registered users for China Edition on all platforms reached over 150 million.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.6.0 was released for Mobile and Windows.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.7.0 was released for Mobile and Windows.

A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.9.0 was released for Mobile and Windows.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.11.0 was released for Mobile and Windows.
A version based on Java Edition 1.14.3 was released for Windows.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.12.0 was released for Mobile and Windows.
Registered users for China Edition on all platforms reached over 300 million.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.13.0 was released for Mobile and Windows.
Minecraft server Hypixel announced that a China-exclusive server was to close.
NetEase closed the China-exclusive Hypixel server.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.14.30 was released for Mobile and Windows.
A version based on Java Edition 1.15.2 was released for Windows.
Registered users for China Edition on all platforms reached over 400 million.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.16.10 was released for Mobile and Windows.
A version based on Java Edition 1.16 was released for Windows.
A version based on Java Edition 1.16.4 was released for Windows. A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.16.201 was released for Mobile and Windows.
A version based on Minecraft RTX was released for Windows.
A version based on Bedrock Edition 1.17.2 was released for Mobile and Windows.

images.caption: On Windows platforms, China Edition Bedrock Edition is a remake by NetEase itself, its release will be later than other platforms ~1-2 versions in general. The picture shows the Bedrock Edition that is in the Microsoft Store and Bedrock Edition (China Edition) file comparison.

texts.text: China Edition

Minecraft: China Edition[a] is a localized edition of Java and Bedrock editions for mainland China, developed by Mojang Studios and NetEase. China Edition has 500 million players as of October 2021.[3]
Contents

1 Gameplay
2 Features
3 Interface
3.1 Windows platform
3.2 Mobile platform
4 Comparison
5 System requirements
6 History
7 Gallery
8 Notes
9 References
Gameplay
Main articles: Java Edition § Gameplay and Bedrock Edition § Gameplay
Features

Free to download and play
Cloud storage‌[Java Edition only]
Friends system, with text chat support
In-game text content is heavily censored, including but not limited to chat, Book and Quills, Written Books, Signs, renamed items (via Anvils) and mobs (via renamed Spawn Eggs or Name Tags)
Multiple in-game player names are allowed‌[Java Edition only]
Server rental and management in launcher
An alternative to the Realms service
The server owner does not have permission to upload or download server maps‌[Bedrock Edition only]
The server can be backed up, restored, or reset with allocated storage (6 GB, 6144 MB in total)
Maximum file size for server maps that can be backed up is 1 GB, 1024 MB
The server will be shut down after the storage space is full
Can install mods in rental mod service (Bukkit core)‌[Java Edition only]
Online game server
Different from rental server, the owner has full permission
Usually adopt third-party server application
Have in-server shop in UI
Visible when checking online game servers
Use Emerald or Diamond as currency, see below
VIP Membership Center
CN¥20 per month (≈ US$2.80 per month)
CN¥12 per month (≈ US$1.70 per month) after 40% off discount
VIP members can purchase seasonal merchandise at a discount of 40% rather than the original price. All purchased benefits and merchandise will be temporarily unavailable if the membership expired
Patch system
An alternative to the Marketplace service, normally only available in the Bedrock Edition of the game
Including API, resource packs, skins, and mods, all contributed by community creators or officially reproduced from Marketplace
Some patches are free
Use Emerald or Diamond as currency instead of "Minecoins"
Will not conflict or affect in-game items
One-click patching

No achievements on Bedrock Edition
Virtual joystick support (with eight directions)‌[Bedrock Edition only]
New UI‌[Bedrock Edition only] and pause menu
"The Shopkeeper's Gifts" where players can watch ads to earn scratch cards rewarding varying amounts of emeralds and diamonds (limited to 5 per day) or unlock specific patches, including texture packs, mods, and custom maps, ranging from 1-2000 ads per item (limited to 35 per day).‌[Bedrock Edition only]
"Chaos/Apocalyptic Game mode" with new features of which includes a new "Apocalyptic realm" with exclusive achievements, items, biomes, mobs, and 4 new bosses to fight.[4]
"Three Kingdoms: Chibi Game mode" adds new mobs, npc, boss, character special abilities, blocks, currency (diamonds for microtransactions), vouchers and weapon forging system (synthesize, forge, cast, upgrade, enhanced crystals, strengthening crystals).[5][6]
NPC‌[Bedrock Edition only]
The operator holds Worldbuilder permissions by default, which means that its interface can be edited when the education option is turned off
Some functionality is limited:
Advanced settings (invalid after reboot)
Command
Proprietary interface for developing advanced component features‌[Bedrock Edition only]
Load custom items using item ID 456 (Portfolio in Education Edition)
Use special values to distinguish between different custom items
If custom item not register to mod will have these feature
In the hotbar will look like an apple item
Named item.mod.-1
Interface
Windows platform

Wonderful World (Simplified Chinese: 精彩世界 Pinyin: Jīngcǎi shìjiè): Game recommendation page including news, recommended resources, special topic, best videos, etc.
Game Center (Simplified Chinese: 游戏中心 Pinyin: Yóuxì zhōngxīn): Online gaming server.
Patch Center (Simplified Chinese: 组件中心 Pinyin: Zǔjiàn zhōngxīn): Patch resource area including functional patches, visual patches, map patches, and gameplay patches.
Game Forum (Simplified Chinese: 游戏论坛 Pinyin: Yóuxì lùntán): Game discussion area including tips for tutorials, Q&A, video live, etc.
Game Live (Simplified Chinese: 游戏直播 Pinyin: Yóuxì zhíbō): Streamer Live area.
Novelties (Simplified Chinese: 新鲜事 Pinyin: Xīnxiān shì): Official account/player game updates publishing area.
Mobile platform

Game (Simplified Chinese: 游戏 Pinyin: Yóuxì): The page to launch the game, including Singleplayer, Rental Server Games, Multiplayer Lobby, Online Games, etc.
Friends (Simplified Chinese: 好友 Pinyin: Hǎoyǒu): Friend system including adding friends, chatting with friends, playing with multiplayer game, etc.
Community (Simplified Chinese: 社区 Pinyin: Shèqū): Including Novelties, News and Community, which are official account/player game dynamics publishing area, game news publishing area, and in-game forum.
Resource Center (Simplified Chinese: 资源中心 Pinyin: Zīyuán zhōngxīn): Similar to Marketplace, it allows players to buy and download game maps, add-ons, texture packs, and skins.
My House (Simplified Chinese:我的家园 Pinyin: Wǒ de jiāyuán): A place where you have your own house that you can design. There are coins, which you can get by using the crafting table to solve a puzzle (eg. how to make a sword). The coins are used to buy furniture, decorations, and walls/floor. You also get a fox as a pet when you level up.
